conclusion: Mass of block P is m, mass of block Q is 4m, initial velocity of block P is v0, coefficient of kinetic friction between Q and inclined plane is tan(theta), no friction between P and inclined plane, no loss of kinetic energy in collision between P and bumper.
To find velocities of P and Q immediately after collision, consider conservation of momentum and conservation of kinetic energy during elastic collision.
From conservation of momentum: m_P v_{P_0} = m_P v_{P_1} + m_Q v_{Q_1}
From conservation of kinetic energy: (1/2) m_P v_{P_0}^2 = (1/2) m_P v_{P_1}^2 + (1/2) m_Q v_{Q_1}^2
Simplifying kinetic energy equation: v_{P_0}^2 = v_{P_1}^2 + 4v_{Q_1}^2
